meanings.sent1: The elidible words in the sentence were easily removed without changing the meaning.
meanings.sent2: The teacher explained that the elidible information could be left out of the report.
meanings.sent3: The elidible details in the story made it shorter but just as interesting.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an elidible ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The elidible stars in the sky seemed to disappear as the city lights brightened.

meanings.definition: That can be omitted or slurred over.
meanings.sent1: The elidible mistakes in the essay were easily overlooked by the teacher.
meanings.sent2: He found the elidible parts of the conversation unimportant and skipped over them.
meanings.sent3: The elidible errors in the recipe made it taste surprisingly better.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was like an elidible whisper in the noisy room.
meanings.sent5: The elidible obstacles on the path seemed to vanish as she moved forward.
